comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content:
Yes, THAT Jim Thorpe.  Thorpe won gold medals at the 1912 Olympics in track and field, played MLB and was in early professional football for Canton which later became an NFL team.  He also played professionally in basketball as a barn stormer with his own team.

He drove in the winning run in the famous "double no hitter" between Hippo Vaughn or the Cubs and Fred Toney of the Reds in 1917 at Wrigley Field.
